properties.name: Burns Court Cinema
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby

properties.name: Cherry Lane Cottage
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby Located on the rear property of the Nash Bungalow, the Cherry Lane Cottage was originally a “mother-in-law” out building. Completely updated and accessed via private lane, this 1BR/1BA cottage is a hidden gem just three blocks from Main Street.

properties.name: Daawat Indian Cuisine
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby

properties.name: Deja Brew Coffeehouse
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby

properties.name: Grammy's Place
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby 1765-1771 Morrill Street, Sarasota, FLOlive “Grammy” Paris was the matriarch of Discovery Days Preschool, and we’ve fondly named this restored collection of 1920s bungalows in her honor. An original two-family wood frame bungalow with two 1BR/1BA apartments features wood floors, new kitchens and baths, and even a wood burning fireplace in one unit (for those frosty Florida winters). There is also a large second floor 1BR/1BA apartment with open air porch. These units abut a nationally accredited neighborhood preschool, and present a fine example of mixed-use in downtown Sarasota.

properties.name: Hawkins Court Cottage
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby An enchanting purple 1BR/1BA cottage on secluded, brick paved Hawkins Court. Completely updated, with wood floors, large kitchen, natural gas heat and appliances, and very private fence yard. The walls and ceiling are original stained cypress.

properties.name: Island Park
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby

properties.name: LPM Office
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby    235 S. Osprey Ave, Sarasota, FLOwned and operated by local green builder Devin Rutkowski, LPM manages nearly sixty apartments, cottages, and bungalows in Historic Laurel Park, Downtown Sarasota’s urban village. Our unique properties exude historic charm and feature many green amenities including energy-efficient appliances and lighting, low-VOC paints, and low-flow fixtures. We also offer a recycling program with incentives.

properties.name: Laurel Park
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby

properties.name: Mrs. Gray's Place
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby 404 Julia Place, Sarasota, FlNamed after the beloved wife of colorful local artist Arlie Gray, Mrs. Gray’s Place is a large two-story 1920s historic building with a beautiful 2BR/1BA apartment on the first floor and a large 1BR/1BA apartment with separate entrance on the second floor. Behind the main house is a quaint detached studio apartment.

properties.name: Nash Bungalow
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby 1920 Laurel Street, Sarasota, FLHaving only had three owners since it was first built, this adorable “shotgun” bungalow retains much of its original character, including stained wood walls and ceilings in the living room. The home is named for Clara May Nash, whose husband was an electrician for the Ringling Brothers’ Circus when it resided in Venice, FL. With 2BR/1BA, wood floors, front porch, rear deck, and a private yard, the Nash Bungalow is a Florida classic.

properties.name: Payne Park
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby  Tree-lined walking paths, rolling hills, tennis courts, ponds, an amphitheater, and a skate park. Payne Park hosts organized events as well as impromptu soccer and frisbee matches. Great for dog-owners, this is one of Sarasota\'s nicest parks.

properties.name: Seven Gables
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby 405 South Osprey Avenue, Sarasota, FLOne of a handful of Laurel Park’s “Grand” historic structures dating back to the early 1920s. Originally constructed for a wealthy doctor, the house has since been divided into five apartments with ten off street parking spaces. Its name name is derived from the seven gable roof dormers built within the roof line and accessible from the second floor apartments.

properties.name: Silva Court
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby 229 South Osprey Ave, Sarasota, FLSilva Court is a locally designated Mediterranean Revival Historic Structure that includes twenty-six residential rental apartments and two commercial storefronts. All of the apartments have been updated with wood flooring and new appliances, ceiling fans, and fixtures. The twenty-four large studio apartments and two one-bedroom apartments feature tall ceilings, generous natural light, full kitchens, and bathrooms with tubs.

properties.name: Silva Court Cottages
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby 237-245 South Osprey Avenue, Sarasota, FLSome years ago, undocumented in the annals of history, five small wood frame old-Florida cottages were moved adjacent to the Silva Court apartment buildings. Altogether they provide four studio apartments, two 1BR/1BA cottages, and a 2BR/1BA bungalow, all lovingly restored. The ideal combination of charm, privacy, communal space, and proximity to downtown.

properties.name: The Caboose
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby So named because the original cottage resembled a small train car, long and narrow. An addition doubled its size and added a host of recycled house parts, including wood casement windows, a front door with a circular window, and a claw foot tub. With tall ceilings, wood floors, and a large outside deck, The Caboose is quite a find.

properties.name: Towles Court Artist Colony
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby

properties.name: Villas Morrill
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby 1910-1920 Morrill Street, Sarasota, FLLocated directly across the street from the Towles Court artist colony, the Villas consist of a total of seven 1BR/1BA apartments and four 2BR/1BA apartments in three buildings. If you’re looking for a place to live downtown that combines affordability and spaciousness without sacrificing safety, the Villas are your best bet.

properties.name: Whole Foods Market
properties.description: Posted by Joshgrigsby
